definition: to resist/imperial/(classical) to drive (a chariot)/to manage/to govern
place at the imperial court, where emperor handled government affairs, gave orders etc
old way of writing 和田[He2 tian2], Hotan (prior to 1959)
official seal/imperial or royal seal/papal bull
kesi or k’o-ssu, Chinese silk tapestry woven in a pictorial design
Giuseppe Castiglione (1688-1766) Jesuit who served as Qing court painter for 50 years
ribbon (as a decoration)/cordon (diagonal belt worn as a sign of office or honor)
lit. gold and jade fill the hall (idiom)/fig. abundant wealth/abundance of knowledge
(bird species of China) common pheasant (Phasianus colchicus)
(myth.) peaches of immortality, kept by Xi Wangmu/fresh or confectionery peaches offered as a birthday gift
may you enjoy boundless longevity (idiom)/long may you live
